I am told that during the tea ceremony turning the chawan clockwise 
when =
returning it to the host was an indication of hostilities to come. 
Since s=
amurai held the ceremony under such high regard they would never 
outwardly=
 show anything but respect to thier host and instead used this

ure to display thier true feelings.

I was wondering if anyone else has hea=
rd of this and can purhaps shed
